str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Simeon or Simon. From the same as Simon; Symeon, the name of five Israelites.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
And, even, also, namely.
From eu and lambano; taking well, i.e. Circumspect.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and dechomai; to admit (figuratively) endurance); by implication, to await.
From parakaleo; imploration, hortation, solace.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
And, even, also, namely.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
